main event: A resident of New Orleans observed a bright circular object in the sky for about five to ten minutes on 3 February 1957.
interesting points: The object was circular, flat, and bright white in color, with an estimated size similar to a tennis ball., The object traveled at an estimated speed of approximately 900 miles per hour., The observation lasted approximately three seconds before the object disappeared over the horizon., Witness described the object as having no visible means of propulsion and emitted no sound., The weather conditions were clear, and visibility was twelve miles at the time of observation.
witness description: The witness was a 49-year-old electrical engineer.
